alert.note: Alert for Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 10:40PM AKST until February 03 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected and periods of freezing drizzle possible. Additional snow accumulation of 1 to 3 inches. Light ice accumulations of less than a tenth of an inch expected. * WHERE...Pelican, Elfin Cove, Petersburg, Wrangell. * WHEN...Through 3 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Wet snow may be difficult to manage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers and periods of freezing drizzle will continue through early Thursday morning. As of 8 AM AKST, 6 to 9 inches of snow has been reported in Pelican, Petersburg, and Wrangell. As of 11 AM, freezing rain was reported in Petersburg. A lull in the heaviest precipitation is expected this afternoon and evening. During that time the region can expect periods of light freezing rain mixing in at times before a full transition to rain by Thursday. Confidence is low in the exact timing of the transition to rain as an earlier or later transition time will greatly impact snowfall amounts.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
